item.tooltip: returns the value of a date, time or timestamp after adding a specified number of days, months, years, minutes, hours and/or seconds or years to a source date, time or timestamp.
item.userdata: returns the value of a date, time or timestamp after adding a specified number of days, months, years, minutes, hours and/or seconds or years to a source date, time or timestamp.

item.tooltip: returns the value of a date, time or timestamp resulting from subtracting a specified number of days, months, years, minutes, hours and/or seconds or years from a source date.
item.userdata: returns the value of a date, time or timestamp resulting from subtracting a specified number of days, months, years, minutes, hours and/or seconds or years from a source date.

item.tooltip: returns the current time in HH.MM.SS.mmmmmm format.
item.userdata: returns the current time in HH.MM.SS.mmmmmm format.

item.tooltip: converts a conventional date (YYYYMMDD) to julian date format, returning only the day number.
item.userdata: converts a conventional date (YYYYMMDD) to julian date format, returning only the day number.

item.tooltip: formats/reformats a date value. also converts a two (2) digit year to a four (4) digit year by adding (greater-than) 2000 for sources and adding (less-than)1900 for sources. The formats are specified by three mandatory characters: YMD, which can be in any order, and may optionally be seperated by other characters such as / or -
item.userdata: formats/reformats a date value. also converts a two (2) digit year to a four (4) digit year by adding (greater-than) 2000 for sources and adding (less-than)1900 for sources. The formats are specified by three mandatory characters: YMD, which can be in any order, and may optionally be seperated by other characters such as / or -

item.tooltip: returns the current date and time in YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM--SS format.
item.userdata: returns the current date and time in YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM--SS format.

item.tooltip: returns the day portion of a source date.
item.userdata: returns the day portion of a source date.

item.tooltip: returns the name of a day from a number (1 through 7). (see DAYOFWEEK for determining based on date)
item.userdata: returns the name of a day from a number (1 through 7). (see DAYOFWEEK for determining based on date)

item.tooltip: returns the day number (1 through 7) from the current date.
item.userdata: returns the day number (1 through 7) from the current date.

item.tooltip: converts GMT to Local Time.
Returns true if the data is in YYYY-MM-DD format.
item.userdata: Returns true if the data is in YYYY-MM-DD format.

item.tooltip: derive a Julian date value (YYYYDDD format) from the current date.
item.userdata: derive a Julian date value (YYYYDDD format) from the current date.

item.tooltip: converts Julian date to a conventional date in YYYYMMDD format.
item.userdata: converts Julian date to a conventional date in YYYYMMDD format.

item.tooltip: returns the number of a month from a specific date.
item.userdata: returns the number of a month from a specific date.

item.tooltip: returns the name of month from a number (1 through 12)
item.userdata: returns the name of month from a number (1 through 12)

item.tooltip: converts the time value in HH:MM:SS format into the equivalent number of seconds that the time represents.
item.userdata: converts the time value in HH:MM:SS format into the equivalent number of seconds that the time represents.

item.tooltip: returns the day portion of a Julian date from the current date.
item.userdata: returns the day portion of a Julian date from the current date.

item.tooltip: converts the day portion of a Julian date into a date formatted as YYYYMMDD. The YYYY value is derived from the current year.
item.userdata: converts the day portion of a Julian date into a date formatted as YYYYMMDD. The YYYY value is derived from the current year.

item.tooltip: returns the current eight (8) byte MVS storeclock (STCK) value in a hexadecimal character format (i.e. 16 bytes).
item.userdata: returns the current eight (8) byte MVS storeclock (STCK) value in a hexadecimal character format (i.e. 16 bytes).

item.tooltip: returns the current time in HH.MM.SS format.
item.userdata: returns the current time in HH.MM.SS format.

item.tooltip: returns a timestamp value from the current date/time in YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SS.mmmmmm format.
item.userdata: returns a timestamp value from the current date/time in YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SS.mmmmmm format.

item.tooltip: returns the current date in YYYYMMDD format.
item.userdata: returns the current date in YYYYMMDD format.

item.tooltip: returns the number of a week within the year from a specified date in YYYYMMDD format.
item.userdata: returns the number of a week within the year from a specified date in YYYYMMDD format.

item.tooltip: returns the day of the week.
item.userdata: returns the day of the week.

item.tooltip: returns the current year value in YYYY format.
item.userdata: returns the current year value in YYYY format.

item.tooltip: Returns the decimal representation of the content of a binary field.
item.userdata: Returns the decimal representation of the content of a binary field.

item.tooltip: converts a binary value to its hexadecimal equivalent in character format.
item.userdata: converts a binary value to its hexadecimal equivalent in character format.

item.tooltip: converts a character data string into a hexadecimal format. The code page of the hexadecimal translation is determined by the platform in which the C2X function was executed (i.e. EBCDIC for z/OS).
item.userdata: converts a character data string into a hexadecimal format. The code page of the hexadecimal translation is determined by the platform in which the C2X function was executed (i.e. EBCDIC for z/OS).

item.tooltip: returns the name of the directory in which a file type datastore resides.
item.userdata: returns the name of the directory in which a file type datastore resides.

item.tooltip: returns the name of the physical datastore file.
item.userdata: returns the name of the physical datastore file.

item.tooltip: returns the data_string with any chracters not found in the inclusion_string removed. If 'MATCH' is specified, only parts of the data_string which match the inclusion_string exactly will be returned.
item.userdata: returns the data_string with any chracters not found in the inclusion_string removed. If 'MATCH' is specified, only parts of the data_string which match the inclusion_string exactly will be returned.

item.tooltip: capitalizes the first letter of each word in text_string.
item.userdata: capitalizes the first letter of each word in text_string.

item.tooltip: returns the first length characters in data_string
item.userdata: returns the first length characters in data_string

item.tooltip: returns the number of characters in data_string
item.userdata: returns the number of characters in data_string

item.tooltip: returns text_string with all characters converted to lower case
item.userdata: returns text_string with all characters converted to lower case

item.tooltip: removes any characters found in character_string from the begining of data_string. If 'MATCH' is specified, only removes an occurance of the exact character_string from the beginning of data_string
item.userdata: removes any characters found in character_string from the begining of data_string. If 'MATCH' is specified, only removes an occurance of the exact character_string from the beginning of data_string

item.tooltip: returns the substring of data_string starting at character start_position (1-based) and continuing for length characters.
item.userdata: returns the substring of data_string starting at character start_position (1-based) and continuing for length characters.

item.tooltip: this is the opposite of EXCLUDE, returning all characters not found in character_string.
item.userdata: this is the opposite of EXCLUDE, returning all characters not found in character_string.

item.tooltip: returns the last length characters in string
item.userdata: returns the last length characters in string

item.tooltip: removes any characters found in character_string from the begining of data_string. If 'MATCH' is specified, only removes an occurance of the exact character_string from the end of data_string
item.userdata: removes any characters found in character_string from the begining of data_string. If 'MATCH' is specified, only removes an occurance of the exact character_string from the end of data_string

item.tooltip: examines a source data string and compares it against a second `search' data string. If the search data string is found within the source data string, SQData returns the position of the matching characters within the source data string. If no match is found, a value of zero (0) is returned.
item.userdata: examines a source data string and compares it against a second `search' data string. If the search data string is found within the source data string, SQData returns the position of the matching characters within the source data string. If no match is found, a value of zero (0) is returned.

item.tooltip: returns a string literal, concatenating any arguments
item.userdata: returns a string literal, concatenating any arguments

item.tooltip: allows you to translate a specific character within a data string with another character. This function examines the data string and replaces all occurrences of a specific character with a user specified replacement character.
item.userdata: allows you to translate a specific character within a data string with another character. This function examines the data string and replaces all occurrences of a specific character with a user specified replacement character.

item.tooltip: removes characters specified in character_string from the input data_string, or returns an empty string if no matching characters are found.
item.userdata: removes characters specified in character_string from the input data_string, or returns an empty string if no matching characters are found.

item.tooltip: returns text_string with all characters converted to upper case
item.userdata: returns text_string with all characters converted to upper case

item.tooltip: returns substring of string, starting at character position and reading until the first space or end-of-string is found.
item.userdata: returns substring of string, starting at character position and reading until the first space or end-of-string is found.

item.tooltip: returns the number of words (seperated by at least one(1) space) are in the input string
item.userdata: returns the number of words (seperated by at least one(1) space) are in the input string

item.tooltip: The X2B function converts a hexadecimal to its binary value equivalent. The return length is half of the input length.
item.userdata: The X2B function converts a hexadecimal to its binary value equivalent. The return length is half of the input length.

item.tooltip: converts a data string in hexadecimal format into a character data string.
item.userdata: converts a data string in hexadecimal format into a character data string.

item.tooltip: logical AND, returns true(1) if all arguments evaluate TRUE, or false(0) if any evaluate FALSE.
item.userdata: logical AND, returns true(1) if all arguments evaluate TRUE, or false(0) if any evaluate FALSE.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a value is greater than one value and less than another value, inclusive
item.userdata: determines whether or not a value is greater than one value and less than another value, inclusive

item.tooltip: logical equivilence test. Returns TRUE(1) if both values are equal, and FALSE(0) if they are not.
item.userdata: logical equivilence test. Returns TRUE(1) if both values are equal, and FALSE(0) if they are not.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a field/column has changed by comparing the before image with the after image.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a field/column has changed by comparing the before image with the after image.

item.tooltip: logical greater-than-or-equal-to test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 >= value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.
item.userdata: logical greater-than-or-equal-to test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 >= value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.

item.tooltip: logical greater-than test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 > value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.
item.userdata: logical greater-than test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 > value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.

item.tooltip: logical IF. Can be used with ELSE, ELSE IF, OTHERWISE
item.userdata: logical IF. Can be used with ELSE, ELSE IF, OTHERWISE

item.tooltip: logical ELSE. Used in an IF statement with DO (some task) END.
item.userdata: logical ELSE. Used in an IF statement with DO (some task) END.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a value is greater than one value and less than another value, exclusive
item.userdata: determines whether or not a value is greater than one value and less than another value, exclusive

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a source value is a decimal number, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a source value is a decimal number, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a source value is an integer, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a source value is an integer, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a source value is null, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a source value is null, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a source value is numeric, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a source value is numeric, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.

item.tooltip: determines whether or not a source value is text, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.
item.userdata: determines whether or not a source value is text, returning TRUE(1) if it is and FALSE(0) if it is not.

item.tooltip: logical less-than-or-equal-to test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 less-than-or-equal-to value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.
item.userdata: logical less-than-or-equal-to test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1 less-than-or-equal-to value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.

item.tooltip: logical less-than test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1less-than value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.
item.userdata: logical less-than test. Returns TRUE(1) if value1less-than value2, and FALSE(0) otherwise.

item.tooltip: logical reverse-equivilence test. Returns FALSE(0) if both values are equal, and TRUE(1) if they are not.
item.userdata: logical reverse-equivilence test. Returns FALSE(0) if both values are equal, and TRUE(1) if they are not.

item.tooltip: logical NOT, reverses the value of the input, so a logical FALSE becomes TRUE and a logical TRUE becomes FALSE
item.userdata: logical NOT, reverses the value of the input, so a logical FALSE becomes TRUE and a logical TRUE becomes FALSE

item.tooltip: Determines whether or not a value matches one or more search values.
item.userdata: Determines whether or not a value matches one or more search values.

item.tooltip: logical OR, returns true(1) if any argument evaluate TRUE, or false(0) if all evaluate FALSE.
item.userdata: logical OR, returns true(1) if any argument evaluate TRUE, or false(0) if all evaluate FALSE.

item.tooltip: returns the relative number of the record in a source datastore.
item.userdata: returns the relative number of the record in a source datastore.

item.tooltip: If the result of the function(s) within the WHERE clause are true (1), the functions that appear below the WHERE function are executed. Otherwise, the functions below the WHERE function are not executed.
item.userdata: If the result of the function(s) within the WHERE clause are true (1), the functions that appear below the WHERE function are executed. Otherwise, the functions below the WHERE function are not executed.

item.tooltip: returns the absolute value of numeric_field
item.userdata: returns the absolute value of numeric_field

item.tooltip: returns the input values mathematically added together
item.userdata: returns the input values mathematically added together

item.tooltip: returns numeric value, minus one(1)
returns dividend divided by divisor, with precision scale.
item.userdata: returns dividend divided by divisor, with precision scale.

item.tooltip: returns numeric value, plus one(1)
returns the first argument modulo the second argument
item.userdata: returns the first argument modulo the second argument

item.tooltip: returns the result of mathematically multiplying the arguments
item.userdata: returns the result of mathematically multiplying the arguments

item.tooltip: returns decimal_value, rounded to precision scale.
item.userdata: returns decimal_value, rounded to precision scale.

item.tooltip: subtracts one number from another and returns the difference of the subtraction.
item.userdata: subtracts one number from another and returns the difference of the subtraction.

item.tooltip: returns the number of records/rows in a particular group as specified within the SQData SELECT subcommand.
item.userdata: returns the number of records/rows in a particular group as specified within the SQData SELECT subcommand.

item.tooltip: returns the first occurrence of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.
item.userdata: returns the first occurrence of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.

item.tooltip: returns the last occurrence of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.
item.userdata: returns the last occurrence of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.

item.tooltip: returns the largest value of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.
item.userdata: returns the largest value of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.

item.tooltip: returns the smallest value of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.
item.userdata: returns the smallest value of a particular data element within a group of records/rows.

item.tooltip: totals each occurrence of a numeric data element within a group of records/rows.
item.userdata: totals each occurrence of a numeric data element within a group of records/rows.

item.tooltip: invokes a predefined SQData mapping procedure (PROC) within an SQData command script.
item.userdata: invokes a predefined SQData mapping procedure (PROC) within an SQData command script.

item.tooltip: The CLOSEDS function closes a target datastore.
item.userdata: The CLOSEDS function closes a target datastore.

item.tooltip: returns the qualifier of the DB2 table that is currently being processed via a DB2 datastore or a DB2 changed data capture (CDC) datastore.
item.userdata: returns the qualifier of the DB2 table that is currently being processed via a DB2 datastore or a DB2 changed data capture (CDC) datastore.

item.tooltip: returns the name of the DB2 table that is currently being processed via a DB2 datastore or a DB2 changed data capture (CDC) datastore.
item.userdata: returns the name of the DB2 table that is currently being processed via a DB2 datastore or a DB2 changed data capture (CDC) datastore.

item.tooltip: The EMPTY function returns a null value.
item.userdata: The EMPTY function returns a null value.

item.tooltip: examines a set of values and returns the largest value in the set.
item.userdata: examines a set of values and returns the largest value in the set.

item.tooltip: examines a set of numeric values and returns the smallest number in the set.
item.userdata: examines a set of numeric values and returns the smallest number in the set.

item.tooltip: The FULLKEY function returns the fully concatenated key of the current IMS segment. This function is useful for appending key data to child segments prior to writing the data to an output datastore. Also, see the PFK_ function.
item.userdata: The FULLKEY function returns the fully concatenated key of the current IMS segment. This function is useful for appending key data to child segments prior to writing the data to an output datastore. Also, see the PFK_ function.

item.tooltip: returns name of the IMS database that is currently being processed via an IMS datastore or an IMS changed data capture (CDC) datastore.
item.userdata: returns name of the IMS database that is currently being processed via an IMS datastore or an IMS changed data capture (CDC) datastore.

item.tooltip: returns name of the IMS segment that is currently being processed via an IMS datastore or an IMS changed data capture (CDC) datastore.
item.userdata: returns name of the IMS segment that is currently being processed via an IMS datastore or an IMS changed data capture (CDC) datastore.

item.tooltip: retrieves a single field from a lookup or Join table based on the position of the lookup pointer returned from the LOOK function. The data returned by the LOOKFLD function can be mapped into a field of a target datastore.
item.userdata: retrieves a single field from a lookup or Join table based on the position of the lookup pointer returned from the LOOK function. The data returned by the LOOKFLD function can be mapped into a field of a target datastore.

item.tooltip: checks the result of a lookup or join table search to determine whether or not a lookup key was found or not. LOOKFOUND returns a found (1) or a not found (0) value based on the results of the search via a LOOK function.
item.userdata: checks the result of a lookup or join table search to determine whether or not a lookup key was found or not. LOOKFOUND returns a found (1) or a not found (0) value based on the results of the search via a LOOK function.

item.tooltip: executes a function or group of functions a specified number of times.
item.userdata: executes a function or group of functions a specified number of times.

item.tooltip: used to perform source to target data mapping within a function or nested set of functions. This function maps a source field/column, variable or function output to a target field.
item.userdata: used to perform source to target data mapping within a function or nested set of functions. This function maps a source field/column, variable or function output to a target field.

item.tooltip: used to `normalize' the contents of a source datastore record into one (1) or more target datastores. This function is typically used when the target datastore(s) is a relational table and the source datastore records contain de-normalized data (i.e. repeating groups/occurs).
item.userdata: used to `normalize' the contents of a source datastore record into one (1) or more target datastores. This function is typically used when the target datastore(s) is a relational table and the source datastore records contain de-normalized data (i.e. repeating groups/occurs).

item.tooltip: returns NULL
executes a command that can normally be issued from a UNIX or Windows command prompt. SQData waits for the command to complete and then continues processing.
item.userdata: executes a command that can normally be issued from a UNIX or Windows command prompt. SQData waits for the command to complete and then continues processing.

item.tooltip: The OUTDS function is used to explicitly write records/rows to a target datastore without waiting for all of the target fields to be mapped (which happens automatically within the Integration Engine).
item.userdata: The OUTDS function is used to explicitly write records/rows to a target datastore without waiting for all of the target fields to be mapped (which happens automatically within the Integration Engine).

item.tooltip: returns the alias name of a source or target datastore as defined within the SQData script.
item.userdata: returns the alias name of a source or target datastore as defined within the SQData script.

item.tooltip: display text_to_output in the report output. If rc is non-zero, will stop proccessing and exit with the return code rc.
item.userdata: display text_to_output in the report output. If rc is non-zero, will stop proccessing and exit with the return code rc.

item.tooltip: The PFK_ function returns a parent ;apos;s full key (PFK) of the current IMS segment. This segment must be a dependent segment (i.e. not a root segment).
item.userdata: The PFK_ function returns a parent ;apos;s full key (PFK) of the current IMS segment. This segment must be a dependent segment (i.e. not a root segment).

item.tooltip: Either HOLDs or RESUMEs the reading of records from the primary datastore
item.userdata: Either HOLDs or RESUMEs the reading of records from the primary datastore

item.tooltip: The RECNAME function returns the name of the object associated with a DESCRIPTION alias. In the case of IMS, this object is the segment name, which can also be obtained using the IMSSEGNAME function. For VSAM CDC records, this is the eight (8) byte file name. For relational tables, this is the name of the source table.
item.userdata: The RECNAME function returns the name of the object associated with a DESCRIPTION alias. In the case of IMS, this object is the segment name, which can also be obtained using the IMSSEGNAME function. For VSAM CDC records, this is the eight (8) byte file name. For relational tables, this is the name of the source table.

item.tooltip: increments a number by the value of a second numeric value. Each time that the SEQNUM function is called for the same numeric value(s), the SEQNUM function continues to increment the value from its previous state.
item.userdata: increments a number by the value of a second numeric value. Each time that the SEQNUM function is called for the same numeric value(s), the SEQNUM function continues to increment the value from its previous state.

item.tooltip: stop proccessing and exit with return code rc
item.userdata: stop proccessing and exit with return code rc

item.tooltip: The UEXIT function allows you to include C functions/programs in SQDATA. The C program is complied and included as a .dll and included in the root program.
item.userdata: The UEXIT function allows you to include C functions/programs in SQDATA. The C program is complied and included as a .dll and included in the root program.

item.tooltip: references a function alias. Please note that the function alias being referenced by VALUE must appear before the VALUE function in the command script.
item.userdata: references a function alias. Please note that the function alias being referenced by VALUE must appear before the VALUE function in the command script.

item.tooltip: returns the before image of a source field involved in a transaction update or delete. For insert operations, a null value is returned.
item.userdata: returns the before image of a source field involved in a transaction update or delete. For insert operations, a null value is returned.

item.tooltip: returns the change operation of the transaction insert, update or delete operation. I for Inserts, R for updates, or D for deletes.
item.userdata: returns the change operation of the transaction insert, update or delete operation. I for Inserts, R for updates, or D for deletes.

item.tooltip: returns the entire unaltered changed data capture (CDC) record from a CDC type datastore.
item.userdata: returns the entire unaltered changed data capture (CDC) record from a CDC type datastore.

item.tooltip: returns the eight (8) byte MVS storeclock value (STCK) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore. This storeclock value reflects the time that the data was changed within a transaction or program.
item.userdata: returns the eight (8) byte MVS storeclock value (STCK) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore. This storeclock value reflects the time that the data was changed within a transaction or program.

item.tooltip: returns a 26 byte timstamp from a changed data capture (CDC) record. The timestamp is in YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SSSSSS format. This value reflects the time that the update took place.
item.userdata: returns a 26 byte timstamp from a changed data capture (CDC) record. The timestamp is in YYYY-MM-DD-HH.MM.SSSSSS format. This value reflects the time that the update took place.

item.tooltip: returns a 20 byte packed (without punctuation) timestamp from a changed data capture (CDC) record. The timestamp is in YYYYMMDDHHMMSSSSSS format. This value reflects the time that the source record was updated.
item.userdata: returns a 20 byte packed (without punctuation) timestamp from a changed data capture (CDC) record. The timestamp is in YYYYMMDDHHMMSSSSSS format. This value reflects the time that the source record was updated.

item.tooltip: returns the user ID of the individual/group that initiated the change to the source record within a transaction or program.
item.userdata: returns the user ID of the individual/group that initiated the change to the source record within a transaction or program.

item.tooltip: returns the unit-of-work identifier (recovery token) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore.
item.userdata: returns the unit-of-work identifier (recovery token) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore.

item.tooltip: returns the current table name in the source datastore (CDCIN) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore.
item.userdata: returns the current table name in the source datastore (CDCIN) from the changed data capture (CDC) record in a CDC type datastore.

item.tooltip: returns name of the IMS program that made the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.
item.userdata: returns name of the IMS program that made the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.

item.tooltip: returns name of the IMS PSB that was used to make the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.
item.userdata: returns name of the IMS PSB that was used to make the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.

item.tooltip: returns name of the IMS transaction that was used to make the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.
item.userdata: returns name of the IMS transaction that was used to make the change to the source data that was subsequently captured by one of the SQData IMD data capture agents.

item.tooltip: With the SETIMAGE function, you set the image to either 'BEFORE' or 'AFTER', and then use the same PROC for both images. The SETIMAGE function returns FALSE if you are asking for BEFORE and the change is not an update.
item.userdata: With the SETIMAGE function, you set the image to either 'BEFORE' or 'AFTER', and then use the same PROC for both images. The SETIMAGE function returns FALSE if you are asking for BEFORE and the change is not an update.

item.tooltip: Main Routing Procedure for an Engine. (Traditional Syntax)
item.userdata: Main Routing Procedure for an Engine. (Traditional Syntax)

item.tooltip: Main Routing Procedure for an Engine. (URL/new Syntax)
item.userdata: Main Routing Procedure for an Engine. (URL/new Syntax)

item.tooltip: performs a search on a pre-defined lookup or join table and sets the position (pointer) of the lookup table to the row that meets the criteria of the search.
item.userdata: performs a search on a pre-defined lookup or join table and sets the position (pointer) of the lookup table to the row that meets the criteria of the search.

item.tooltip: Template for SetImage

item.userdata: returns the current date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Template for MAPBEFOREkeyChng. Used when target keys can change.
Template for MAPBEFOREkeyChng. Used when target keys can change.
